description: Mauritius is extending travel restrictions for a period of two weeks on foreign passengers coming from or having transited during the last 14 days in countries of the European Union, including United Kingdom and Switzerland. Also, as from today 20 00 GMT,  all foreign passengers coming or transiting from Reunion Island will not be allowed to enter Mauritius for the next two weeks. 16/03/2020

description: Mauritius has begun its Anti-Influenza vaccine especially targeted to elderly people and people with special abilities. The daily programme started from April 5th  from 8:30 a.m to 3 p.m.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: on 5th of May 2020, The government of Mauritius shared an update on the current status of the country as no new case has been reported. Out of the 332 positive cases recorded, 319 patients have been successfully treated and currently, there are only three active cases. Since the beginning of the outbreak in Mauritius, 19 681PCR tests have been carried out. After the launch of the mass testing for Covid-19 nine days ago, 31 305 frontliners have been screened through Rapid Antigen Tests. Covid-19 related deaths stand at ten and 100 passengers are under quarantine.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: on 5th of May 2020, The government of Mauritius shared an update on the current status of the country as no new case has been reported. Out of the 332 positive cases recorded, 319 patients have been successfully treated and currently, there are only three active cases. Since the beginning of the outbreak in Mauritius, 19 681PCR tests have been carried out. After the launch of the mass testing for Covid-19 nine days ago, 31 305 front liners have been screened through Rapid Antigen Tests. Covid-19 related deaths stand at ten and 100 passengers are under quarantine. The health monitoring will be on-going in relation to the risk of infection and duration of the pandemic. description: In the last week of March 2020, Mauritius has received 100,000 polymerase chain reaction (PCR tests). In addition, 231 tons of medical equipment has been ordered from China. In view with the shortage of medical equipment around the globe,this measure is to ensure COVID-19 patients are treated with utmost treatment in order to reduce the spread of the virus.
target_geog_level: One or more other geographical or administrative units within one or more countries (e.g. county)

target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Mauritius set to receive 100 000 PCR tests
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: Mauritius will go in lockdown for two weeks, as from 6:00 on March 20
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: The lockdown in Mauritius is being extended to Monday 04 May 2020, to further contain the spread of the Covid-19 in the country UPDATE: The original lockdown was set to last until April 3'rd, it has been extended to May 4
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: Mauritius on May 1 announced the extension of its lockdown until June 1 UPDATE: The original lockdown was set to last until May 4 but was extended to June 1
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: On May 15, Mauritius announced its first phase of easing its lockdown introduced on 20 March 2020 due to the spread of COVID-19, with some sectors resuming their business activities UPDATE: On May 15 Mauritius eased its lockdown that started om March 20 by letting some sectors resume business activities
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: The Prime Minister of Mauritius announced that the decision has been taken for the lift of all business and activity lockdowns ordered earlier to cope with the Covid-19, as from Monday 15 June 2020 UPDATE: The prime minister announced Mauritius' lockdown, that began March 20, will end June 15
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: A sum of 50% of the Minimum Wage, amounting to Rs 5100 is being given to workers employed in the informal sector. In the same respect, A Special Relief amount for SME having a net profit of less than Rs 50 million, as well as a loan amounting to Rs 1 million is being offered to enterprises with a net profit not exceeding Rs 10 million.
target_geog_level: One or more other geographical or administrative units within one or more countries (e.g. county)
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: With the economy going into a dip, Mauritius has come out with a plan for its vulnerable citizens such as a home payment system where pensioners receive their monthly pensions at home in view to curb the transmission of COVID-19. A cut of 20% in electricity bills is also being implemented for some 65,000 households while small enterprises whose electricity consumption do not exceed 125 kilowatts will receive a reduction of 10%.
target_geog_level: One or more other geographical or administrative units within one or more countries (e.g. county)

description: With the economy going into a dip, Mauritius has come out with a plan for its vulnerable citizens such as a home payment system where pensioners receive their monthly pensions at home in view to curb the transmission of COVID-19. A cut of 20% in electricity bills is also being implemented for some 65,000 households while small enterprises whose electricity consumption do not exceed 125 kilowatts will receive a reduction of 10%. The end of this policy is not reported. UPDATE: Mauritius relieve plan for its vulnerable citizens such as a home payment system. A cut of 20% in electricity bills is also being implemented for some 65,000 households while small enterprises whose electricity consumption does not exceed 125 kilowatts will receive a reduction of 10%. The end of the policy is not reported.
target_geog_level: One or more other geographical or administrative units within one or more countries (e.g. county)

description: With complete lockdown in Mauritius, the government has provided essential food packs to needy households as from 26th March 2020. Households who are registered on the Social Register and benefitting from Carer's allowance and the residents of Homes are to obtain these food packs.
type_text: Providing food stuffs to needy people-those who cannot afford to buy additional food items for the lockdown period
target_geog_level: One or more other geographical or administrative units within one or more countries (e.g. county)
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Mauritius is delivering a digitalised Work Access Permit (WAP) to those individuals who have to report to work despite the curfew orders. As of 14th May 2020, some 200,000 WAPs have been delivered with the main purpose being, to allow those who need to travel from home to work.
type_text: WAPs allow those who are requested to report to their work place physically to travel from their residence to work without breaching curfew orders.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Mauritius is delivering a digitalised Work Access Permit (WAP) to those individuals who have to report to work despite the curfew orders. As of 14th May 2020, some 200,000 WAPs have been delivered with the main purpose being, to allow those who need to travel from home to work. The end date is not reported. description: Mauritius proposes Bill that will provide necessary legal impetus to enforce post-lockdown measures. This includes the mandatory wearing of Mask in public places and gradual return to work. As of now, only people with Work access permit are allowed to work. Workers belonging to this category: public officers, carers, baby-sitters, planters, fishermen and the self-employed may resume work as from 15 May on condition that they are in possession of the proper authorisation.
type_sub_cat: Both Disseminating and Gathering information related to COVID-19
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: Mauritius proposes Bill that will provide necessary legal impetus to enforce post-lockdown measures. This includes the mandatory wearing of Mask in public places and gradual return to work. As of now, only people with Work access permit are allowed to work. Workers belonging to this category: public officers, carers, baby-sitters, planters, fishermen and the self-employed may resume work as from 15 May on condition that they are in possession of the proper authorisation. This policy has an unlimited time span. UPDATE: Mauritius proposes Bill that will provide necessary legal impetus to enforce post-lockdown measures. This includes the mandatory wearing of masks in public places and a gradual return to work. As of now, only people with Work access permits are allowed to work. Workers belonging to this category: public officers, carers, babysitters, planters, fishermen, and the self-employed may resume work as from 15 May on condition that they are in possession of the proper authorization.
type_sub_cat: Both Disseminating and Gathering information related to COVID-19
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: As of January 23, passengers arriving to Mauritius inbound from China are quarantined

description: As of 23 January 2020, passengers arriving in Mauritius inbound from China are quarantined. This restriction was in place until 19 March 2020 when the international borders were closed. UPDATE: As of 23 January 2020, passengers arriving in Mauritius inbound from China are quarantined. This restriction was in place until 19 March 2020 when the international borders were closed.

description: Starting February 28, 2020, Mauritius announced that Mauritians coming from Iran or Italy during the last 14 days will be automatically placed in quarantine for a period of two weeks.
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Starting February 28, 2020, Mauritius announced that Mauritians coming from Iran or Italy during the last 14 days will be automatically placed in quarantine for a period of two weeks. This restriction ended on 19  March 2020 with the closure of all borders. UPDATE: Starting February 28, 2020, Mauritius announced that Mauritians coming from Iran or Italy during the last 14 days will be automatically placed in quarantine for a period of two weeks. description: Effective March 16, 2020, all Mauritians coming from countries of the European Union, including United Kingdom and Switzerland will be automatically placed in quarantine for a period of two weeks.
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: Effective March 16, 2020, all Mauritians coming from countries of the European Union, including the United Kingdom and Switzerland will be automatically placed in quarantine for a period of two weeks. This policy was valid until March 19, 2020, when all inbound flights were banned to Mauritius. UPDATE: Effective March 16, 2020, all Mauritians coming from countries of the European Union, including the United Kingdom and Switzerland will be automatically placed in quarantine for a period of two weeks. This policy was valid until March 19, 2020, when all inbound flights were banned to Mauritius.
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: The Mauritian government orders that all passengers, Mauritian and International, arriving before 6H00 GMT (10h00 local time) Thursday, 19 March 2020, will be placed automatically in quarantine.
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
target_geog_level: All countries

description:
Under Mauritius' Prevention and Mitigation of Infectious Disease
(Coronavirus) Regulations 2020, initiated on March 20, 2020, a medical practitioner with reasonable grounds to believe that a person may be infected with coronavirus or had contact with somebody infected with coronavirus shall cause the person to be quarantined.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

These businesses will be requiring shoppers with alphabetical order of their surnames to shop at their stores. Wearing of masks and maintaining social distance will be mandatory until 30 May 2020 UPDATE: Mauritius easing down restrictions on lockdown with a slow re-opening of businesses under hygienic regulations. These businesses will be requiring shoppers with the alphabetical order of their surnames to shop at their stores.  This restriction was valid until 30 May 2020.

description: Mauritius is enforcing the policy where in supermarkets, only one person per family is permitted to shop for 30 minutes and shopping time slots have been allocated according to surnames.  It is also mandatory for citizens to wear a face mask and to bring their ID cards while shopping. UPDATE: This is to strengthen the existing policy of vising supermarkets under surnames. The new policy seeks to enforce the wearing of mask at all times while they seek to relax the lockdown at the same time.

Supermarkets and small shops will remain open on monday to friday from  9am to 5pm. To restrict the mass gathering, Mauritius has a enforced a policy on gathering using the alphabetical order of their surnames. For instance, Customers will have to go in alphabetical order as follows:
A-F: Monday and Thursday; G-N: Tuesday and Friday; O-Z: Wednesday and Saturday; Supermarkets closed on Sunday.

After some deliberations, the National Assembly of Mauritius has accepted adopted the bill on Workers’ Rights Act and the Employment Relations Act under the COVID-19. This was mentioned on the 17th May, 2020.
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks in all public spaces/everywhere
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
